title: JSO: 14-year-old accidentally shot by friend in Northwest Jacksonville
content:
Please install the latest Adobe Flash Player Plugin to watch this content.
JACKSONVILLE, Fla. - The Jacksonville Sheriff's Office has found that a 14-year-old who was shot at The Oaks of Durkeeville at 1605 N. Myrtle Avenue on Monday afternoon was accidentally shot by a friend.
According to JSO Lt. Jackson Short, the teen initially told police that he had just arrived home from school and was outside of his house when someone drove by and began shooting.
Latest News Headlines from Action News
Investigators later found that the teen and his friend were actually playing with a rifle while home alone. The teen and his friend later came clean about what really happened when confronted by police with evidence.
The teen and his friend will not be charged, but investigation into the ownership of the gun will continue. Police do not believe the gun belongs to anyone in the teen's family.
The teen suffered a gunshot wound to the lower torso and was taken to UF Health Jacksonville with non-life-threatening injuries.
